name: Website Defacement – Containment
description:
# 🌍 Website Defacement – Containment

---

## 🎯 Usage

Respond quickly to:

* Remove any visible malicious content
* Restore controlled display
* Eliminate unauthorized access
* Preserve evidence for investigation and hardening

---

## ⚙️ Prerequisites before starting

* ✅ Incident qualified: confirmed as **website defacement** linked to server compromise, severity assessed
  → Recommended sheet: *Website Defacement – Qualification*
* 🔑 Administration capabilities available (network, system, security) or rapid mobilization of third-party support/managed service provider

---

## 📌 Objective

**Freeze** the attack, **restore** a controlled page, and **preserve** evidence.

### ✅ Limit further damage

1. Take the website offline
2. Preserve backups

### ✅ Preserve traces

3. Retain the affected website content
4. Save logs

### ✅ Protect the organization’s image

5. Publish a maintenance page
6. Communicate

### ✅ Limit propagation within the IS

7. Restrict spread to the rest of the information system

---

## 📄 Resource

👉 [Full reflex sheet – INTERCERT-FR](https://www.intercert-france.fr/wp-content/uploads/2025/06/fichereflexe-defigurationweb-endiguement.pdf)

tasks.title: Measure 2 – Preserve backups
tasks.description:
### 🎯 Objective

Preserve backups essential for restoring the website in case of defacement or destructive incident.

### 📌 Actions

* Preserve website backups

  * Identify backup resources to protect:

    * Configuration
    * Code
    * Business files
    * Database
  * Preserve these backups by taking them offline or exporting them

### ✅ Deliverables

* Backups preserved
* Backup list added to the **activities** of this task

tasks.title: Measure 7 – Limit propagation to the rest of the information system
tasks.description:
### 🎯 Objective

Consider that the attack may have been more severe than the defacement. If an admin account was compromised, prevent its use on other systems.

### 📌 Actions

* Review all accesses of the compromised admin account

  * Other websites accessible from the same management interface
  * Administration interfaces of the information system or cloud tenant, if applicable
  * Remote access
  * VPN
* Investigate possible propagation of the attack across the information system

  * Check for abnormal connections from the host server to the rest of the IS
  * Check for abnormal outbound Internet connections from the host server

### ✅ Deliverables

* Propagation contained
* All information gathered added to the incident (activities, observables)

tasks.title: Measure 4 – Preserve logs
tasks.description:
### 🎯 Objective

Preserve logs before rotation to investigate attacker footprints and eliminate initial access and persistence methods.

### 📌 Actions

* Preserve logs from third-party systems (EDR, Proxy, WAF, firewall)
* Preserve logs from host servers
  → Management interface logs
  → Website logs
  → System logs
* Increase traceability
  → Extend log retention period
  → Increase log verbosity
  → Set up real-time log export to a log sink

### ✅ Deliverables

* Logs preserved
* Log list added to the **activities** of this task

tasks.title: Measure 6 – Communicate
tasks.description:
### 🎯 Objective

Website defacement generally harms the organization’s reputation by displaying illegitimate political or ideological claims.

### 📌 Actions

* Communicate publicly to disavow the illegitimate display

### ✅ Deliverables

* Communication issued and documented in the **activities** of this task

tasks.title: Measure 5 – Publish a maintenance page
tasks.description:
### 🎯 Objective

Protect the organization’s image.

### 📌 Actions

* Publish a maintenance page
  → Use a simple static HTML maintenance page with only text and local images
  → Apply all security patches to the host and web server
  → Disable all unnecessary web server plugins for serving static HTML content

### ✅ Deliverables

* Maintenance page deployed
* Confirmation of deployment added to the **activities** of this task

tasks.title: Measure 3 – Preserve the affected website content
tasks.description:
### 🎯 Objective

Reduce the attack surface.
If host servers have not been shut down or paused, remove attacker access to uploaded files on compromised servers.

### 📌 Actions

* Move the affected website content into a new folder prefixed with INCIDENT, outside the web service’s reach

### ✅ Deliverables

* Implemented measures documented in the **activities** of this task

tasks.title: Measure 8 – Limit propagation on host machines
tasks.description:
### 🎯 Objective

If host servers were not preserved and only the website was taken offline, protect against attack propagation using the actions below.

### 📌 Actions

* Reset server admin accounts
* Investigate attack propagation on the host system
* Reset authentication secrets stored on the host server

### ✅ Deliverables

* Propagation contained
* All information gathered added to the incident (activities, observables)

tasks.title: Measure 1 – Take the website offline
tasks.description:
### 🎯 Objective

Stop malicious display, limit damage to the website, and prevent further compromise spread.

### 📌 Actions

* Take the website offline

  * If possible, switch to maintenance mode
  * Otherwise, stop the website service (but keep the host server running)
* Preserve host servers

  * If virtual machines:

    * Pause the servers
    * Disconnect virtual network interfaces
    * Create a snapshot of the servers (disk and memory)
    * Rename the machine to MACHINE\_UNDER\_INVESTIGATION
  * If physical Windows machines, put them into hibernation
  * Otherwise, if possible, isolate the machines from the network while keeping physical, virtual, or out-of-band admin access:

    * Disable all inbound traffic from the Internet to host servers
    * Disable all outbound traffic from host servers to the Internet
  * As a last resort, power off the machine

### ✅ Deliverables

* Website taken offline and under control
* Actions documented in the **activities** of this task
